required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pelvic Microbiomes of Benign and Malignant Ovarian Diseases
clinical_study.official_title: The Role of Pelvic Microbiomes During the Malignant Transformation of Benign Ovarian Diseases

brief_summary.textblock: This case-control study aims to compare the pelvic microbiomes of benign ovarian diseases and ovarian malignancies by 16s RNA techniques and culture. Discharges/flushing fluid from vagina, faces and fimbria end of fallopian tube are collected from age and menopausal status matched patient before and during procedures of laparoscopies. The discharges/flushing fluid would be sent for 16s RNA analysis and microculture respectively, and the results would get self-contrasted comparison and case-control comparison.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference of species distribution of microorganism according to 16s RNA analysis
primary_outcome.description: The difference of species of microorganism distribution according to 16s RNA sequencing analysis between control group and study group, and between different sampling sites in each arm

primary_outcome.measure: Difference of species distribution of microorganism according to microculture outcomes
primary_outcome.description: Difference of species distribution of microorganism according to microculture outcomes between control group and study group, and between different sampling sites in each arm

arm_group.description: The group consists of patients of benign ovarian diseases and health conditions (eg infertility), who would accept the tests of pelvic microbiomes.
The group consists of patients of high grade serous carcinoma, who would accept the tests of pelvic microbiomes.

intervention.description: 16s RNA analysis and microculture of discharges/flushing fluid from vagina, faces and fimbria end of fallopian tube

biospec_descr.textblock: Discharges/flushing fluid from vagina, faces and fimbria end of fallopian tube are going to sent for analysis of 16s RNA.

study_pop.textblock:
Group of benign ovarian diseases: patients with definite benigh ovarian diseases or health conditions (eg infertlity)
Group of malignant ovarian diseases: patients with definite diagnosis of high grade serous carcinoma

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Laparoscopy procedures
- Specific pathological diagnosis
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous history of pelvic surgeries
- Evidences of pelvic inflammation diseases

patient_data.ipd_description: We would share individual participant data to all other researchers
